intro: Tetramolopium flaccidum, commonly known as the flaccid tetramolopium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it typically grows in dry, open habitats. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
